data.name: RES_ExceptionLoadingConfiguration
data.value: Error loading Configuration Manager config parameters.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidConfigurationDocument
data.value: The configuration document isn´t a well formed xml document

data.name: RES_ExceptionSavingConfigurationDocument
data.value: Xml document invalid format

data.name: RES_ExceptionAppMisConfigured
data.value: The storage provider for the section '{0}' can't be initialized, because during the initialization process an exception was thrown, please check the InnerException and correct the configuration file for the storage provider.

data.name: RES_ExceptionProviderInvalidAssembly
data.value: Cannot load the provider {0} assembly

data.name: RES_ExceptionDefaultProviderInit
data.value: Error initializing the default provider - XmlFileStorage

data.name: RES_ExceptionProviderInvalidType
data.value: Invalid provider type. Wrong class in provider type - {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionSectionInvalid
data.value: Invalid section name. The section does not exist - {0}. Check the /configuration/applicationConfigurationManagement/configSection node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <configSection name="XmlConfig"> <configProvider assembly="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.XmlFileStorage" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.XmlFileStorage.XmlFileStorage" signed="false" encrypted="false" keyStore=""/> </configSection>

data.name: RES_ExceptionHandlerNotWritable
data.value: The given section handler does not support the IConfigurationSectionHandlerWriter interface - {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidSectionHandler
data.value: The given section handler does not support the IConfigurationSectionHandler interface - {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionXMLSectionNotFound
data.value: The XML document does not define the section '{0}'.

data.name: RES_ExceptionStorageProviderException
data.value: Error using storage provider - {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionSectionNotFound
data.value: Section '{0}' not defined on the configuration file. Check the /configuration/configSections/section node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <section name="XmlConfig" type="WinApp.CustomSectionHandler,WinApp" />.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateType
data.value: The type name '{0}' cannot be created. Check the /configuration/configSections/section node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <section name="XmlConfig" type="WinApp.CustomSectionHandler,WinApp" />

data.name: RES_ExceptionTypeNotSpecified
data.value: The type name was not specified on the section definition - {0}. The type name '{0}' cannot be created. Check the /configuration/configSections/section node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <section name="XmlConfig" type="WinApp.CustomSectionHandler,WinApp" />

data.name: RES_ExceptionSignatureCheckFailed
data.value: The signature check has failed for the section '{0}'.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidCacheElement
data.value: Internal error: The cache element is invalid.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidKeyValue
data.value: Internal error: The cache key value is null.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidExtendedFormatArguments
data.value: The extended format is invalid. Cache expiration time must be specified

data.name: RES_ExceptionProviderInit
data.value: Creating Storage Provider and Cache for section '{0}' where storage type = '{1}' and assembly = '{2}'

data.name: RES_ExceptionDataProtectionProviderInit
data.value: Error initializing data protection provider - {0}. Provider - {1}

data.name: RES_ExceptionConfigurationManagerInvalidSectionName
data.value: The section name can´t be null or an empty string, please provide a valid section name.

data.name: RES_ExceptionConfigurationManagerIncorrectSectionName
data.value: The section name specified was not defined on the configuration, please provide a valid section name, check the configuration file for the defined section names.

data.name: RES_ExceptionConfigurationManagerDefaultSectionIsNotHashtable
data.value: The provider defined in the default section (or the first section defined) does not return a Hashtable or any IDictionary implementation. Please change the section provider using 'System.Configuration.DictionarySectionHandler' or a provider returning an IDictionary implementation or a Hashtable.

data.name: RES_TrueInXmlConfigFile
data.value: true
data.comment: Configuration file true value, the case does not matters.

data.name: RES_XmlConfigSectionNodeName
data.value: configSection

data.name: RES_XmlConfigSectionName
data.value: name

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheNodeName
data.value: configCache

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheEnabled
data.value: enabled

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheRefresh
data.value: refresh

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheRefreshOnChange
data.value: refreshOnChange

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheSigned
data.value: signed

data.name: RES_XmlConfigCacheEncrypted
data.value: encrypted

data.name: RES_XmlConfigProviderName
data.value: configProvider

data.value: assembly

data.name: RES_XmlConfigProviderType
data.value: type

data.name: RES_XmlConfigDataProtectionProviderNodeName
data.value: protectionProvider

data.name: RES_XmlConfigDataProtectionProviderAssembly
data.value: assembly

data.name: RES_XmlConfigDataProtectionProviderType
data.value: type

data.name: RES_XmlConfigXPathConfigSections
data.value: /configuration/configSections

data.name: RES_XmlConfigXPathSection
data.value: section[@name='{0}']

data.name: RES_XmlConfigNodeNameCmabSection
data.value: applicationConfigurationManagement

data.name: RES_ExceptionDetailType
data.value: Type: '{0}' - Assembly: '{1}'

data.name: RES_XmlConfigTypeAttribute
data.value: type

data.name: RES_XmlConfigDefaultSectionAttribute
data.value: defaultSection

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantLoadAssembly
data.value: Could not load the Assembly specified where AssemblyName = {0} and TypeName = {1}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateInstanceUsingActivate
data.value: Could not Activate the Type specified where AssemblyName = {0} and TypeName = {1}.

data.name: Res_XmlConfigEncryptionAlgorithmType
data.value: encryptionAlgorithmType

data.name: Res_XmlConfigEncryptionAlgorithmKey
data.value: encryptionAlgorithmKey

data.name: Res_ExceptionInvalidEncryptionKey
data.value: The encryption key isn´t configured or is invalid. Check the key attribute in the provider configuration

data.name: Res_ExceptionCantEncrypt
data.value: Can´t encrypt the configuration

data.name: Res_ExceptionCantDecrypt
data.value: Can´t decrypt the configuration

data.name: Res_ExceptionInvalidTypeName
data.value: The type name specified is invalid, assembly name must be specify (namespace.type,assembly) - {0}.The type name '{0}' cannot be created. Check the /configuration/configSections/section node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <section name="XmlConfig" type="WinApp.CustomSectionHandler,WinApp" />.

data.name: Res_UnableToAllocateBuffer
data.value: Unable to allocate plaintext buffer.

data.name: Res_ExceptionMarshallingData
data.value: Exception marshalling data.

data.name: Res_ExceptionAllocatingEntropyBuffer
data.value: Unable to allocate entropy data buffer.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEntropyMarshallingData
data.value: Exception entropy marshalling data.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEncryptionFailed
data.value: Encryption failed.

data.name: Res_ExceptionUnableToAllecateCipherTextBuffer
data.value: Unable to allocate cipherText buffer.

data.name: Res_ExceptionDecryptionFailed
data.value: Decryption failed.

data.name: Res_ExceptionFormattingMessage
data.value: Failed to format message for error code '{0}'.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEncryptionPermission
data.value: Argument must be of type EncryptionPermission.

data.name: RES_TrueInXmlConfigFile
data.value: true
data.comment: Configuration file true value the case does not matters.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidRegistrySubKey
data.value: Invalid RegistrySubKey attribute at the XML configuration: {0}

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantGetSectionData
data.value: Cannot retrieve registry value for section '{0}'.

data.name: RES_ExceptionSignatureCheckFailed
data.value: Signature check fails, the section was altered.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantWriteRegistry
data.value: Cannot write the section on the specified registry key {0}\{1}. Exception {2}

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantUseNullKeys
data.value: The section name is null, o an empty string, please provide a valid section name.

data.name: RES_ExceptionDisallowedRegistryKey
data.value: The Registry provider could not access the requested registry hive, {0}, because it is not an allowable Hive. Please check the configuration and confine registry access to Hives HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, HKEY_CURRENT_USER, and HKEY_USERS.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidConnectionString
data.value: Invalid connection string specified on the connectionString attribute (or the connection string placed on the regitry key pointed by the attribute connectionStringRegKeyPath) at the XML configuration file. '{0}'. Check the /configuration/configSection/configProvider node in the application config file (assemblyfilename.config). This node must be like <configProvider assembly="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.SqlServerStorageReader" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.SqlStorage.SqlServerStorageReader" connectionString="Data Source=localhost;Initial Catalog=MyDB;User ID=sa;Password=" signed="false" encrypted="false" />

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantOpenConnection
data.value: Failed to open the connection using the connection string: {0}. Connection string can be mentioned in various formats like: 1. server=localhost;database=cmab;Integrated Security=SSPI 2. server=localhost;database=cmab;user id=sa;password=dublin 3. Data Source=localhost;Initial catalog=CMAB;user id=sa;password=dublin The connection string can be added in the config file using the attribute 'connectionString' for the 'configProvder' element. The connection string can also be placed in the registry and the path to the registry can be specified using the 'connectionStringRegKeyPath' attribute for the 'configProvider' element.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantGetSectionData
data.value: Cannot get section value from database for the section '{0}'.

data.name: RES_ExceptionSignatureCheckFailed
data.value: The configuration signature check has failed.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantExecuteStoredProcedure
data.value: Cannot execute stored procedure '{0}' using parameters: '{1}', '{2}'.

data.name: RES_ExceptionStoredProcedureUpdatedNoRecords
data.value: Stored procedure '{0}', executed with parameters: '{1}', '{2}' updated {4} records.

data.name: RES_ExceptionXMLSectionNotFound
data.value: Section '{0}' is not defined in the XML config file. This file must be like <configuration><configSections><section name="applicationConfigurationManagement" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.ConfigurationManagerSectionHandler,Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement, Version=1.0.0.0,Culture=neutral,PublicKeyToken=null" /><section name="XmlConfig" type="WinApp.CustomSectionHandler,WinApp" /></configSections><applicationConfigurationManagement><configSection name="XmlConnfig"><configProvider assembly="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.XmlFileStorage" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.XmlFileStorage.XmlFileStorage" signed="false" encrypted="false" keyStore="Machine"/></configSection></applicationConfigurationManagement></configuration>

data.name: RES_ExceptionXMLSectionNotFound
data.value: Section '{0}' is not defined in the XML document.

data.name: Res_ExceptionInvalidRegKeyFormat
data.value: The '{1}' attribute on the configuration file contains an invalid registry key path. The path must begin with HKEY_CURRENT_USER, HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, or HKEY_USERS, followed by the path to the key begining with \. For example: 'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework'. The invalid registry path is '{0}'.

data.name: Res_ExceptionInvalidRegKeyFormatCantFoundKey
data.value: The '{1}' attribute on the configuration file contains an invalid registry key path, because the key can't be found. The path must begin with HKEY_CURRENT_USER, HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, or HKEY_USERS, followed by the path to the key begining with \. For example: 'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework'. The invalid registry path is '{0}'.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEmptyHashKey
data.value: The attribute 'hashKey' was not found on the configuration file, this attribute must define a base64 key used to hash the values when they are saved using the storage provider.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEmptySymmetricKey
data.value: The attribute 'symmetricKey' was not found on the configuration file, this attribute must define a base64 key used to encrypt and decrypt the values when they are saved using the storage provider.

data.name: Res_ExceptionEmptyInitializationVectorKey
data.value: The attribute 'initializationVector' was not found on the configuration file, this attribute must define a base64 key used to encrypt and decrypt the values when they are saved using the storage provider.

data.name: Res_ExceptionDocumentNotValidated
data.value: The section for the CMAB configuration does not conforms to the XMLSchema provided, please check the document to fix the document. The validation error message is: {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionProtectionProviderInvalidType
data.value: The protection provider can't be initialized, please provide a valid protection provider on the configuratoin file.

data.name: RES_ExceptionBadTypeArgumentInFactory
data.value: The type names must be specified using the full type name and the 5 parts of the assembly name: typeName, assemblyName, version, publicToken, culture.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidConfigurationInstance
data.value: The XmlHashtableSectionHandler can't be used to save (or read) any type of configuration information, the only object supported by this provider is Hashtable.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidDataProtectionConfiguration
data.value: If the 'signed' or 'encrypted' attributes are set to 'true' on the configuration file the section must define a protection provider on the section '{0}' for example: <protectionProvider assembly="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement,Version=1.0.0.0,Culture=neutral,PublicKeyToken=null" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.ConfigurationManagement.DataProtection.DPAPIDataProtection" keyStore="Machine"/>.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidSignatureConfig
data.value: The data on the storage was signed when it was saved, but the signature is disabled for the config provider named '{0}', please enable the signature on the provider or remove the signature from the storage.

data.name: RES_ExceptionRegistryValueLimit
data.value: The registry provider can't write strings larger than 500000 characters. The lare of the data received was {0}, note the OuterXml for the node specified is also included.

data.name: RES_ExceptionConfigurationFileNotFound
data.value: Can´t find the configuration file {0}. You must check the 'path' attribute in the section '{1}'

data.name: RES_ExceptionSectionGroupsNotSupported
data.value: The section groups aren´t supported by the ConfigurationManager, please provide a valid section name.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidEncryptedString
data.value: The encrypted data placed on the configuration storage is invalid, please provide a correct base64 encrypted data.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantDeserializeHashtable
data.value: Can't deserialize the Hashtable.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidConfigurationDocument
data.value: The configuration document isn't a well formed xml document

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectMinutePart
data.value: The minute part must be an integer between 0 and 59

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectHourPart
data.value: The hour part must be an integer between 0 and 23

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectDayPart
data.value: The day part must be an integer between 0 and 31

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectMonthPart
data.value: The month part must be an integer between 0 and 12

data.name: RES_ExceptionExtendedFormatIncorrectDayOfWeekPart
data.value: The day of week part must be an integer between 0 and 6
